Reviews.Title: “Good Location for bed and breakfast sorta !!”
Reviews.Author: HAMID84
Reviews.Content: Well, Stayed in Rydges Camperdown for 2 nights 3 days. The property is very close to the Sydney CBD and everything is very accessible and nearby - Harbors and Bondi and all other beaches as well. No wonder due to closeness to city, its an old building needs refurbishment,but nothing came into my attention that prevent me not to recommand to someone else except couple of things :- 1. Lift is dodgy, be very careful. 2. Toilets and rooms are very moderate, nothing to expect more, but as usual dream beds make your sleep very comfortable. Staff attitude is ok. Night Executive was the most helpful person ever come across. 3. Rooms and Corridors are quite old, you may find some of the furniture is old. So dont get depressed if you have choosen to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty smelly room”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: The place needs an update. Gave us a room, that was nice, when we went to have a shower found a hole where the bath from the room above leaked. They moved us to another room that smelled (ex smoker room I suspect). It had smalls holes and dripping water near the air con unit. Bed was clean. Bathroom broken tiles and mold. Convenient location, but would not recomend

Reviews.Title: “A case of lipstick on a very old bulldog”
Reviews.Author: Gnome G
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are very very tired and used, although Rydges management have splashed out on a lick of paint and some new carpet in the foyer sometime recently I guess. Generally way below the standard of other Rydges hotels overall though... Having said that the rooms are clean and the beds very comfortable. Staffing levels are good, speedy check in and check out. Location is the biggest plus for this hotel - walking distance to scores of good restaurants in Newtown and good bus links get you into the city within 15 minutes anytime of day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but Tired”
Reviews.Author: simpfen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rydges Camperdown because of the proximity to a function we were attending. I had prebooked parking and a bottle of sparkling wine as part of the overall package. When checking in, I was told parking would be an extra $18 per night. I had to tell them that it was included. On arrival at the room, there was no bottle of sparkling wine, so I contacted reception and was told that it would be delivered. When checking out, I was again told that parking would be extra and I was also charged for the bottle of wine and a room service fee. Needless to say I objected and did not pay the double fees. Meals were of average quality but on the last morning there was no hot breakfast available at the buffet due to "technical requirements". The furniture in the rooms are getting dated and overall the place needs a major overhaul. Parking in the basement is limited and very small spaces. $18 a night is reasonable for the inner city area, but I would object to paying that amount to park in the few spaces in the open air (not secure). I would stay there again if needed, but would not expect a quality establishment.

Reviews.Title: “There is better value for money elswhere”
Reviews.Author: SimmoHanoi
Reviews.Content: A typical Rydges Hotel which requires some major upgrade work. The rooms are shabby but would be tolerable if one was looking for a third tier Tourist Hotel within a bus ride to downtown Sydney. Rydges however have suddenly raised their midweek tariff to $170 which is about $70 above what it is worth. Not only that, they want an extra $18 for parking, including outside parking and an extra $20 for a Real Estate Agents idea of a "City View" A tourist would be a lot better off paying a bit more and moving to a proper Down Town Hotel. A Tradesman would be better off moving a few kilometres west at $95 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: hammo99
Reviews.Content: Stayed as close to RPA for medical appointment and 11.00am checkout saves parking hassles if early morning appointments. Extremely good restuarants close by in King street and close to transport to the city TV in room wasn't working and the hotel was old and tired

Reviews.Title: “Old and run down”
Reviews.Author: jandk_95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel as it is the closest to RPA Hospital as we were attending a conference. We found this hotel the most rundown we have seen for a long time. Check in was completed by diinterested staff who were more concerned with joking and flirting with each other. The carpark was under the building with an ancient roller door that looked like it had been crashed into many times. the carparks were haphazard and extememly tight which caused angst when trying to park. Our room was large, but very old furnishings, smeely and not as clean as you expect at this sort of establishment. then airconditioner worked occasionally, it was cooler to open the windows. The room was noisy with a football tema sharing our floor and partying all night. There werre people smoking on a non smoking floor and this fileted into the room. When we mentioned this on check out the girl on the counter said she was unable to do anything as she could not control the guests. We dined the resturant, however this was a big mistake as the food was stogy at best. the meat was very well done when we asked for medium rare and the vegetables were salted to such a point the were indeible. When we mentioned this to the waitress she thought it was a great joke and nothing was offered in the way of apologies. The convienience was good, but there are many far better accomodation options available in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: bluemountainkiwi
Reviews.Content: Rydges Camperdown would have to be the oldest looking of any Rydges Hotels I have stayed at. The look on my face when the lift arrived at my floor and the doors opened would have been priceless. That said, the room I stayed in on Level 4 was large, clean and nicely decorated without being over the top and unlike so many Rydges Hotels the bathroom was actually fairly modern. The view of the city skyline was an added bonus and quite impressive considering the location. As with all Rydges Hotels the bed was extremely comfortable. Being located next to Parramatta Rd there are numerous buses running to the city but remember that they are prepay only between 7am and 7pm weekdays. Taxi fare from city is about $15.00. Rydges Camperdown is very much a case of looks can be deceiving and is a really nice place to stay with prompt check in and check out. The best thing is I paid alot less than I would have at an equivalent city hotel and this included a full buffet breakfast. I also didnt have to take a loan out for car parking. Overall I was more than happy with my stay here and would not hesitate staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: beenthere088
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night as an emergency stay for a family member who was undertaking a operation the next day at RPA and saved fighting the abysmal peak hour traffic. Clean and comfortable. Good value. If you need to be at RPA early on a week day do what we did, drive in and check in early evening the afternoon before and then you are close-by next day. As for parking, RPA and surrounds is a horror story, expect to pay more for the parking than the room the night before. The only issue was that Rydges charged a parking fee for the overnight parking so we parked in the lane beside for free. Why pay for night-time parking when there is ample on-street parking at night? I noticed the carpark was only about a 1/3rd full anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location especially if bringing a car”
Reviews.Author: Mel B
Reviews.Content: We chose this location over the city hotels as we were bringing a car and wanted to use the car for a couple of side trips (the city hotels charge you daily to park, but also charge you whenever you take your car in and out of the parking lot). The location was nice and close to the city as well as Newtown and all of it's eateries. We had our kids with us too and so having a pool was a must which many of the city hotels didn't have either. We got a good "3 nights for price of 2" deal which made the stay really affordable. The foyer and our room was nice and clean and modern, other parts of the hotel though were a bit dated. My only issue was the underground carpark - OK if you have a small car and there isn't alot of others staying at the time, but if you have a 4WD or van or larger, or the car park was packed - it would be a nightmare trying to park as the carpark is full of poles and the car spaces insanely small, however, they do have some spaces out the front that larger cars could use - but those car park spaces aren't secured. We stayed in a city view room which had a really nice view and worth the few extra dollars I think.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: heusm
Reviews.Content: Convenient location just a short bus ride from the heart of Sydney, with around 8 buses you never have to wait long for one to arrive. Hotel has secure underground parking as well as parking available on the ground level, there is a price of $18 per night for this; however that is reasonable in comparison to the $29 fee for internet access, which is excessive for the standard traveller but affordable for the business traveller. The staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The room consisted of a queen and a single bed, both which were very comfy for a good nights sleep. While the room itself was clean and tidy, the bathroom needed a little updating as there was no exhaust fan and the towels were dirty and stained. There was however, some confusion with the seniorâ€™s online benefits; the staff were not aware of the privileges associated with this, thus no free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & close to RPA most of the staff friendly”
Reviews.Author: Susiewrx
Reviews.Content: I had an appointment with the Medical Centre so booked in for 1 night (18th December - very good rate) the young lady who greeted us was very friendly and efficient. We had occassion to call down for some problem and she was up to fix problem within 10min. She was courteous and helpful and made us feel very much at home and acted as if we had been friends for years. She took the time to leave a note (of appreciation as we gave her and the other staff some fruit that we had purchased on the way to Sydney) under our door' The next day we found we had to stay another night, we were informed (by another employee) that we could not have same rate but would be upgraded to a room with extra bed (we said we did not need this) but would be same view of city. When we went to our room it was a terrible view so we spoke to gentleman at reception - he was quite put out but eventually we got a lower floor but a similar view. On the whole the room was comfortable and clean and if not for the first friendly encounter I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Always good”
Reviews.Author: MooshAKL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel numerous times, the service is always warm and friendly and the rooms clean. I never have car parking issues and its a quick walk to a variety of cafes and bars in Newtown.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: Kiwisinoz_11
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and booked this hotel mainly due to very limited options in Newtown/Annandale area. Based on other reviews I didnâ€™t have high expectations but it turned out to be a perfectly adequate place to stay. The room was large enough for us, quiet and had everything we needed, though it was all a little tired and run down. The pool would have been fun for the kids had it been warm enough to use it (it was November). We ordered room service when we arrived at 10 pm and the meal was delicious. Breakfast OK too. There were some annoying problems such as we had booked a cot for our 2 year old but when we arrived â€“ late at night - they couldnâ€™t find a cot anywhere, but they brought us an extra mattress which worked fine. Also the internet cable was broken, and note pad hadnâ€™t been replaced and was full of other peopleâ€™s scribbles. The one thing that concerned me was that the door did not fully close on its own, so we almost went out with it unlocked. Overall, I wouldnâ€™t book it for a summer vacation, but if you need a comfortable and convenient place to stay in that area its just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to the city”
Reviews.Author: Roses273
Reviews.Content: Our room must have been a refurbished room as it was modern and stylish with a lovely bathroom - not a medicine cabinet in sight. Really spacious and quiet. Only negatives are the pool and surrounding areas really need a makeover and the hotel halls have a musty smell. Cafe Miss just up the road was great for an early brekky and a short walk to king st will see you more dining choices than you can imagine. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can someone explain why it's so difficult to find good quality accommodation for under $200 in central Sydney?”
Reviews.Author: BonzoD
Reviews.Content: There's really nothing wrong with this hotel apart from it's cost v's value. Clean, decent sized room, security parking, ok breakfast and good location (CBD is a short bus ride away) makes it a sensible choice. But $225 all up is just too much for an overnight stay. Just try to find another comparable place for less though. Sigh! PS. the in-room TV didn't work, but I'm sure they would've fixed it if I asked.

Reviews.Title: “It was clean at least”
Reviews.Author: AusJeff
Reviews.Content: Reading a few of the reviews here, I'd agree with most of them. I had to keep telling myself that it is an older building (probably 60's) though boy oh boy could it do with a refurb and some styling. We had a King Suite, so was at least spacious, though not a great layout (chair in front of the TV, so couldn't exactly sit there). Lots of carpet stains, had to laugh at the inbuilt medicine cabinet (with plastic shelves that had long broke) slight refub in the bathroom with a new vanity and sink, but definitely lacks ventilation - so best to leave the door open. The shower was sooo annoying. Probably 15-20 deg difference of hot/cold/hot/cold every 30 seconds or so. Had my own wireless internet, so not sure if there's any available or price, albeit there were some wireless access points around. There was also a bunch of cat 5 cable going to a box in the linen cupboard that was just hanging there. Positives: It was very clean. Even out by the pool area I couldn't find a single cobweb in sight, or even under the eaves of those oh so 60's 70's facade. Didn't notice any dust in common and not so common areas. (Speaking of the pool, access is rather weird. Through the fire stairs, then down another set of external stairs.) Bed wasn't bad, no problems sleeping and woke up feeling fine and refreshed. Staff were mostly great, reception/concierge very helpful. Breakfast - if it isn't included I would definitely go up the road. It wasn't too bad, but not great either. Adequate springs to mind. Didn't hear too much noise from other rooms/floors. So basically, if you're after a clean basic hotel, this place is fine. If you prefer a little more dazzle/modern then this isn't the place for you at all. Oh 1 BIG annoying thing. The damn LED lighting on the elevators on the ground floor - they will send you blind. I had to close my eyes while walking to the lifts. I swear they are burnt in to my retinas for life :(

Reviews.Title: “Competitive rates, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: angb61
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on several occasions. This hotel is well priced for close proximity to the CBD. Rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable. My only gripe would be the bathrooms which need some updating and the showers with intermittent hot water. Carpark takes some negotiating and can be a challenge parking because of the numerous support columns. Overall staff are friendly and helpful. We will stay again when visiting Sydney as the location is convenient and the price is always very competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fairly average location”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice last year for business. Food was always good. Staff excellent and rooms clean. Not much to do in the local area but otherwise a really nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “pretty unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: Sam8675309
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here over the weekend - I am Travel agent and my partner is a priority member of Rydges, so we have a pretty good idea of what a 3 star property tends to have. We stayed in a king suite and were not expecting the world and still managed to be disappointed. We mainly chose this property because of the Location - we needed to be close to Newtown. We arrived around the check-in time - we were both driving, so we both parked in the secure garage, not the easiest garage to navigate through, but you can hardly expect the hotel to remove supporting beams that help hold the building up - so not fussed about that. Went up to the room - first thing I noticed in the room was the total waste of space as soon as you walk in - it looks like what used to be part of the hallway, is now the entrance to your room. There could be somewhere to store suitcases, a tallboy, even just some lighting and full length mirror would have been nice here. The living room was huge, but very bare, old furniture - including a fold out sofa bed, that was so old and used, you couldn't even sit on it. Nice new TV, but old and outdated entertainment box, meant that TV wasn't that great to use anyway. There is an interconnecting door to the next room, but the gaps between the door and the frame are so big that noise just travels through and doesn't feel very private at all. I started getting ready to go out around 5pm - The bathroom has no ventilation fans, the shelves in the medicine cabinet were broken and the broken shelves still sitting in side the cabinet. I found myself constantly stepping away from the water in the shower as the hot water was cutting in and out, as you were at home and someone flushed a toilet somewhere else in the house. This was incredibly annoying... Didn't bother with the food, so no feedback here. I noticed wireless routers in the hallway, but there is no wireless internet signal - so not sure if this is just for security/alarm systems - the rooms are hardwired to the internet - but most of the devices I use to connect can't be connected with an ethernet cable. If you just need a bed, and don't care about anything else, then this is your place - but if you plan on spending any time in the room at all - you might want to reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL BE BACk”
Reviews.Author: mounira h
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here on the weekend, as we had a birhday in Newtown. It was the first time we had stayed at the Hotel and we were both very happy with the service we received from the Staff and Management at the Hotel. Our room was clean and had a great view of the City, our Bed was EXTRMELY comfortable and the Buffet Breakfast was a winner. We would defiantly come back!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price but don't expect much.”
Reviews.Author: rldot1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights whilst my husband was at the University of Sydney across the road. In terms of accessibility, this hotel is pretty good. It is near the University and the RPA Hospital. It is located a short bus ride away from the CBD and there are multiple dining options within an easy walk. However, the hotel is very old (50s to 60s) and although some attempts have been made to modernise it, a lot remains dysfunctional. There is a charge to park your car and the car park, which is presumably as old as the hotel itself, is tiny and difficult to drive through. The room itself was large and spacious but the furniture outdated. The worst thing about our stay was the air conditioning. Or rather, the lack of. The room was very warm and the air conditioning didn't work. We asked for a maintenance person to have a look at it. Their solution? Opening a window.

Reviews.Title: “There are bedbugs in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: abc123324
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night, whilst on a business trip in August 2011. I awoke to a few mosquito-like bites on one arm and intially thought nothing of them. By that evening (after checking out), I realised I was covered in bedbug bites, over all the skin not covered by pyjamas. I contacted the hotel manager by email the next morning (using an email address provided in my reservation documentation), to let him know about the problem and to suggest that the room be fumigated to prevent others experiencing the considerable distress I had been caused by around 150 extremely itchy bites. I did not ask for my money back. Unfortunately, I have had no response at all from the hotel/manager. Do not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: I generally don't post comments but I thought this Hotel deserved one. The hotel is rated as a 3 1/2 star and thats what I was expecting however the room we stayed in (Superior Queen Room) was modern, spacious, clean and I loved the large LCD TV that is wall mounted, I rate this Hotel a 4 star. The staff on the reception desk and the waiters in the restaurant were all very efficient and extremely helpfull. They helped me with directions and on how to get to the city (only 10 min away) nothing was a bother. Even the housekeepr that attended to our rom was really nice and helpfull asking if we needed anything extra. Next time in Sydney I will difinitely be staying at Rydges Camperdown.

Reviews.Title: “Proved a good choice at short notice.”
Reviews.Author: JandDAuckland
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here. Chosen because of proximity to RPA Hospital - 5 mins walk away. The hotel was booked that morning for just one night as we were flying in and arriving late but when we arrived we decided to stay the 3 nights. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and nothing was a bother. We were up-graded to a room on the top floor with city view. The room was spacious and very clean and comfortable but the bathroom was a bit tired, although adequate. There was a traffic hum on our side of the building from busy Parramatta Rd but not too intusive if windows shut. We ate breakfast in hotel each morning and there is a good selection, once again with friendly staff only too pleased to satisfy special orders. We would stay here again. There was an excellent restaurant at cnr Parramatta Rd and Missenden Rd - it looked like a motorcycle repair shop from outside, but you must visit , food delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Inverellboy1975
Reviews.Content: Read some ordinary reviews over the last 12 mths but as usual you have to take these with the proverbial grain as most reviews are disgruntled ones. Hence I wanted to post this one to say it was great. I did make sure to ask for a refurbished room but most are anyway. Room was clean,modern and very comfortable. Service was great and breakfast nice. Would stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to hospital”
Reviews.Author: heinieken
Reviews.Content: Great location for us as we were visiting family in RPA hospital. Bed was very comfy and although there was no road noise, we did seem to hear people walking past our room dragging luggage late at night and early mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Close to medical centres and hospital”
Reviews.Author: aus_isis
Reviews.Content: Older style hotel based on three point / wing design. Rooms are a bit dated but large rooms, good rydges sleep beds and quite location. Staff were good and restaurant open till 9.30 for late arrivals. Fifteen minutes to airport and next to hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: GABETJTBC Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were told the family room we booked months ago was not available due to renovation but they were still offering these rooms on other nights on their website. The room was dirty and dusty, Rust in the bathroom, Tiles were Dirty and the powerpoint was broken. The entire room was not cleaned at all. Their website boasts about their new Dream Beds not sure where these are located as our beds were hard as rocks and we never slept a wink. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Jillj1255093
Reviews.Content: The door was propped open with towels after arriving at 11.30am The toilet was stained with grime and blood! The TV was non operational The entertainment folder was empty and was scribbled on by a child The bathroom tiles were mouldy The cold water tap was missing the cap The lifts were littered and floors not vaccumed I left a necklace in the room and after 4 contacts with the I hotel have not heard about returning it. As a former hotelier perhaps my standards are too high - but this one is appalling. Personal message to the Manager has not resulted in a responce.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: keewest
Reviews.Content: The room was reasonably clean and spacious with a separate sink for the kitchenette which was good as most hotels expect you to use the bathroom vanity to wash up dishes etc. Location was good for inner city Sydney - close to Newtown railway station and main shopping strip and only a short train ride away from the city. No complaints overall.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you need a room on city fringe.”
Reviews.Author: MikefromSydney
Reviews.Content: Close to RPA Hospital and Sydney University. My queen room with one bed was large although the bathroom, with shower over the bath, was compact. I suspect my room was on the noisiest side, being close to Parramatta Rd, and I only noticed traffic noise in the morning. There is a spacious bar, and the restaurant had a very ordinary menu on a Sunday night, ie steaks, burgers etc, and a typical buffet breakfast. They charge $12 a night for secure parking and city buses are close by. If you need a bus you may require a pre-paid ticket. Reception should be able to advise.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience Rydges Camperdown”
Reviews.Author: sticks1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on the 21 Feb 11. First could not find reservation and were abrupt towards me. Room was poor. Some lights not working, bedside still had food wrapper on it. The clock did not work. Hair in bathroom on bench and floor. Broken toilet button. Noisy air con which didnt work properly making room stuffy. Only one towel supplied call for another and was asked to come collect it at reception. Finally got delivered to room. Would never stay here again unless complete change of staff and fittings. Old rundown hotel. Staff handed review sheet on checkout and looked upon as if i had abused them. Totally unfriendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian68
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the end of January 2011. The room was certainly big enough, the beds comfy, the window opened a crack ( bonus) and the air-con worked. Also the kettle and TV were fine. About half the light globes in the room were U/S for all threee nights, although I didn't mention this to reception as it wasn't inconvenient. I couldn't have a bath because the little lever that swaps the shower to the tap was jammed or broken. Again, not a biggy, but demonstrates a lack of maintenance checks. At 70 cents per minute, I decided not to use the internet connection. Breakfast was only OK. At $21.50, I expect coffee that is drinkable and bacon that is fried, not laying flaccid and oily like it had barely touched the frypan. I suspect the breakfast cook is vegetarian, because the eggs were good and the bacon was rubbish every morning. Staff on the front desk were good and on the ball. The bus stop to the city centre ( frequent buses, journey to Circular Quay 25 minutes) is very close by and the man who sells the bus tickets in the shop on the north side of the road very friendly and helpful to tourists. Taxi to the domestic was $27-. Life could be a lot worse- in Cairo , for example.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: breann_888
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed at this hotel for one night while attending to some business at the University of Sydney (which is right across the road). Upon arrival we parked outside the hotel for $12 which was reasonable and although our room was not ready we were offered another one while we waited. The receptionist was friendly but not overly so. We had a room with two queen beds, the room being huge with a small kitchette and medium newly furnished bathroom. We had a view over parramatta road which was lively at night. There was no street noise at all because we were so high up and this in conjunction the comfy beds meant for a great nights sleep. However the rooms were tired looking compared to the bathroom but this notion faded due to the comfort of the room. The hotel is perfect is you need to visit the University of Sydney, Royal Prince Albert Hospital or don't mind a 15 minute bus ride to the CBD of Sydney. The location means for a better night sleep while still having a convenient base for either a leisure or business oriented trip. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Third world Hotel quality”
Reviews.Author: cemtrav
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last ten years due to it's location next to the Uni. First it was Travellodge, then Centra and now Rydges. It has rapidly decayed under it's present ownership and compares to some of the worst hotels I have stayed at in developing countries. The rooms are filthy, the beds sheets stained, the bathrooms covered in mould, the staff rude and the smell overpowering in the hallways. At one time the food here was excellent, but the last time I was not willing to even try it due to the lack of hygene in the hotel. I complained, in writing to both the hotel and Rydges after the last stay. They did not even have the coutesy to acknowledge my complaint. I will never stay here again and have advised my company to remove it from the list of suppliers.

Reviews.Title: “Really needs a major overhaul”
Reviews.Author: cbflor74
Reviews.Content: I don't know anything about this chain, but it's pretty clear they've kind of written off this hotel as not deserving much attention. It desperately needs major refurbishing, because the first word that came to mind when we checked in was "seedy." The two young women at the reception desk were lovely; Annelise was especially helpful when the first room they gave us was completely unsatisfactory and smelled like cooked onions. She moved us to a much nicer room right away, no questions asked. But it's hard not to notice how shabby the public areas are: ratty carpet, chipped paint, inadequate lighting...just sad and unappealing. The restaurant is pathetic, and the breakfast buffet could use some help, too. The long and short is that this hotel is just badly managed or not managed at all. It's always about the details, and they're sorely ignored here. Would definitely not recommend it; there are far nicer hotels in Sydney for less money.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: ColoTraveler96
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where to start. The staff were neutral, which I'm o.k. with, especially when travelling for business, but the rooms were in terrible shape. i had to change rooms three times! The first room literally had the television falling out of the wall, had dingy curtains, and dirty walls. the second room had a window which would not close! I finally got into a room I could live with, but for $200/night I got the equivalent of a $75/night room in most U.S. cities. To topit off they have the gall to charge $29/day to access their cable-based DSL connection to the internet, OUTRAGEOUS! Finally, when I checked out I was informed that I was being charged a 1.5% 'Service fee" for using a credit card! In this era of plastic that is simply highway robbery. Thankfully I didn't have a rental car as they want you to pay $18/day to park your car. This place should be avoided if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Shangel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family which consisted of a two year old, teenagers, young married couple and my husband and I. We booked out three rooms, two city view and one standard. Overall, we were all pleased with our rooms, mine was the standard (no view) and not having the view was no problem. Family members who had the city view had claims of their rooms being too hot...and the air conditioning was not working even after advising reception. We all ordered the full breakfast ($21.50) and they were all delivered to our rooms at the times specified, the breakfasts were huge and we enjoyed them very much. We also ate in the hotel restaurant (dinner). The servings were quite small and really nothing spectacular. The staff were friendly and very approachable. The service was exceptional, including the domestic staff. The location is close to the city and suited our needs perfectly. The only thing I did not like was the underground parking, it was difficult to navigate. Overall, it was an enjoyable stay had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be staying here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: frogstar01
Reviews.Content: Were do I begin!!! My partner and I had booked a Superior Queen room for the night as we were seeing a concert near by. Had fast check-in. As we got to the room our card took us about 10 attempts to open the door very frustrating, this happened everytime we wanted to enter the room throughout stay. Very annoying! Well what can I say about the room! It had a double bed and a single bed in it. It looked nothing like the room we had booked. One of the reasons we booked here as they have the dream bed which are the most comfortable beds ever!! When I looked at the bed it look to be as old as the hotel!! Definently not a dream bed. Had one of the wheels broken on it! When I pulled back the cover on bed which looked to be about 20 years old it had stains all over it and the blanket underneath had hair all over it. So gross. I rang reception and said this dosen't look like the room we had booked. He said sorry they don't have any Superior Queen rooms left! Well maybe they shouldn't have had them on there webpage that they had 3 Superior Queen rooms when I booked! Not happy. He said we could have the $12 parking for free and free breakfast. Well I'm glad the breakfast ws free because I wouldn't have payed $21.50 for it! Not a huge variety to chose from. Bacon under cooked and overall not worth it! Also the bathroom shower was terrible, glad I didn't need to wash hair as It would have been difficult to get hair wet! Also the toilet had black stains in it like it hadn't been cleaned in ages and there was black hair in the bath! Im blonde! Im not one to usually write a review but was very dissapointed with stay here. I am a rydges member and have stayed in numerous other ones and have never had a problem before. I feel for the $171 we payed I think we deserved better. We could have payed abit more and stayed in a much nicer hotel in town. The location was good close to Newtown and great restaurants. Would suggest when booking to ring and comfirm what room you have as the other rooms on website look much updated and has new bedspreads.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Tery
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay here because of the position, and then had to also bring 2 teenage girls to stay with us at short notice so had to book another room. The reservations people were very helpful and got us interconnecting rooms even though the hotel was quite full. Staff at reception were efficient for both check in and check out, although we had a child in a wheelchair and it was raining so we could not park near the entrance because someone without a disabled permit had parked in the disabled spot. The person on reception either couldn't or wouldn't do anything about this. In the whole time we stayed in the hotel there were cars without permits parked in the disabled parking spot. I think that the hotel needs to start monitoring this as it is quite difficult to get a wheelchair in and out of a car in the rain believe me! The rooms were nice but there was no cutlery in the rooms which was also a bit inconvenient as we could not go out in the rain for dinner so bought take away from across the road at Nandos...btw if you want to see bad service check that place out !!!. Overall though, it was a good experience and I would rate the hotel as good value for the price and position.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tropicalshowers
Reviews.Content: We were a small group of parents caring for a number of teenagers who were attending various theatre workshops/functions at the Sydney University and the ATYP. The hotel staff happily accommodated us all on the one floor and were happy to oblige with any request throughout our stay . The hotel is located very close to the Uni and the Royal Prince Alfred Hospital. Buses and taxis are a stones throw away. The rooms were basic but clean, with opening windows which was an added bonus. The room had a mini kitchenette with a small sink , a double stove top & small bar fridge, although we found no pots or pans or cooking utensils. My son & I found no problem with noise even though we kept the window ajar overnight......perhaps we were too exhausted! We enjoyed fabulous breakfasts (& coffee!) at the Hoochie Mama Cafe only a 5 minute walk up Missenden Road towards Newtown. All in all, a good hotel for a reasonable price in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, slow lift, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: michael_balfour
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here for a conference at the uni (over the road). Initially I was given a front room - but there is no double glazing and the windows don't fit the frame so there is a steady breeze and traffic noise. Rooms at back quieter. The hotel is functional, if a little tired. The second lift wasn't walking, and the other is slow, slow, slow. There is no way to walk down stairs (the fire doors are for emergencies only). Morning congestion were regular pain. On positive side staff are helpful, and I feel sorry for them because given better facilities this would make a pleasant hotel. The price is reasonable, the location was great for conference and city, but I think next time I'll go for a local B and B.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: jsmoo1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times and although the rooms are dated and in need of an upgrade, for the price it is very reasonable. Staff are always lovely and helpful. Showers are pretty average and hard to fit under if you're tall. Room service was quick, hot and tasty (got the club sandwich and beef burger). Location is great for visitors to Sydney as Newtowns King St is 5 min walk and the city is a $10-15 cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose well”
Reviews.Author: patchyGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Booking online was a breeze, the prices were the cheapest around the area $100ish a night for 3 nights, the room was used purley to sleep in, it was a little plain but I wasn't expecting a palace. Being close to RPA and Parramatta Rd with express bus to city was a huge benefit, didn't use the restaurant and bar, ate in China town each night, Cruisy little pub up the road with $8 steak and chips cant go wrong. If your looking for opulance at $180 a night this place isn't for you, but if you budget conscious this place will suit you perfectly with fast close transport I'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Room but Excellent service May 2010”
Reviews.Author: Particularwhynot
Reviews.Content: I was travelling looking for a place to stay.. I thought too big about the first Rydges but am only familiar with Rydges in Auckland. In Camperdown it seemed like a cold unattractive lobby when we reached the floor I was glad to ask to look at a room first that came close to a Priority Guest room. Realized i could get the same price at the 4 star in north sydney but out of the way in that area. Very good service from the hotel staff I was grateful for them helping me book a room right there for north sydneys Rydges hotel

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sitegeist
Reviews.Content: I had two major concerns: 1) the state of disrepair of the room - and in particular the bathroom - was distressing. 2) This is my major complaint: I realised when I returned late that evening that I was in a room that reeked of smoke. I found this very distasteful and distracting. The odor made it difficult to sleep and enjoy my stay. Later I found an ashtray in the room confirming my suspicions. There was no sign on the door designating the rooms as a smoking room. Later when I complained to the desk clerk on checkout I was told in an almost flippant manner that the hotel was phasing out smoking and that the previous guest must have been 'bad'. This was one of the worst hotel experiences in my last decade of travel. Why didn't I request a new room? I noticed / recognised the smell late in the evening. I figured I could just soldier through. I was disappointed on three levels regarding the smoking issue: 1) that I was not given a choice / notified about the state of the room. 2) that the desk clerk was not particularly concerned about my discomfort. I wonder if she reported this to management. 3) The fact that such a room could exist. The oppressing feel / smell of the room is my most distinctive memory of the Rydges Camperdown in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Justin39
Reviews.Content: My second time at this Hotel as Iâ€™ve had to spend some time at the Hospital that is just down the road so very convenient. The rooms during my first stay were looking tired and was a bit hesitant to re book, but thought I would give them another go mainly due to the location. But now that the rooms have been refurbished with new bathrooms, beds and carpet they look fantastic, great value for money. I was pleasantly surprised. I have already booked for next month as I have to revisit the Hospital... unfortunately. And the staff was lovely especially in the restaurant. Justin

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING, UNCLEAN.. RYDGES? NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ducati_Girl848
Reviews.Content: The room was unclean... I accidently knocked the bed, and found underneath the bed was absolutely FILTHY! My bottom sheet had been put on without covering the lower section of the bed. I asked for a wake up call as I had a six hour meeting the next day. I was woken up 1.5 HOURS prior to the time I asked to be woken up! How unprofessional!! There were signs everywhere in the hotel advertising a happy hour with canapes during weekdays. There was no happy hour or canapes. I was charged twice for WiFi access due to internet dropping out! Shower was cold (had hot tap on full and no cold water, and it was STILL cold!), and had a leak out the side, which leaked all over my clothes. Upon complaining to staff, I was treated very nonchalant, and given a discount. I made it clear I didn't want a discount, I wanted an apology. Didn't get one. I am a priority privilege member with Intercontinental Hotels and have stayed with them worldwide, and NEVER had any troubles with them. I will never stay at a Rydges again after this experience, would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect anything flash here”
Reviews.Author: Matey9
Reviews.Content: Checked in and they had allocated a non smoking room despite repeated requests for a smoking room. Another friend who doesnt smoke was allocated a smoking room. So it appears if you request a smoking room you dont get one and if you dont smoke you get one. Then the very kind man at the Reception found us a room on the smoking floor but it only had one bed so he offered us a roll away bed. I have slept on rollaway beds before but this one was awful and very very uncomfortable and woke with a very very sore back. When the rollaway arrived the guy just dumped it in the room and ran out of the room so quick and didnt offer to set it up for us. The room itself is very very tired and there is paint peeling from the walls, the bathroom is worn out and cracked and broken tiles and a very filthy toilet. Having stayed at other Rydges Hotels before I was expecting a pretty good standard and was not impressed with this place at all - it would barely meet the 3 star rating. The room service breakfast was great value and arrived on time and was very appetising. There were serious problems with the airconditioning in the room as in the early hours of the morning it was boiling hot in the room and impossible to sleep comfortably. I ended up having to wet a towel to keep me cool. A bit disappointed considering the brand new Rydges.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service?”
Reviews.Author: mimistella
Reviews.Content: Room was neat and clean which suited our needs. Beds were comfortable. LCD T.V. very nice. Male reception person needs education on customer focus i.e. polite communication NOT just the word 'Yes!' spoken in a rude and disinterested tone when approached politely by Guest who asked 'excuse me please.......'. Extremely unprofessional. Full breakfast was atrocious! Not hot, not much on offer and that was just after 8a.m.! Coffee could not be drunk as it actually looked like dirty dish water. A cliche, I know, but true. Dining room staff really should move the butter & margarine away from the industrial size toaster. Just common sense! Please ensure enough hot food for guests as I saw people with barely anything on their plate as baine-maries' were nearly empty. Two staff went about slowly removing and replacing plates but not replacing food! So, do NOT have breakfast there! Female reception staff was very pleasant, courteous and professional. All in all got a good price and it was what it was. Not really complaining but they do need to pick up their act in a couple of areas as above.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dirty, smelly, old. Undergoing renovations.”
Reviews.Author: clownshoes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing renovation for the next few months. Meaning: Construction noise, whole floors that smell of solvents, paint and glue, and old un-renovated rooms that are literally falling apart. Staff are poorly trained and can't answer basic questions such as "what floor is the guest laundry on", and the late night security guard requires an attitude realignment. I was given a room key for a room that was already occupied, which may well have caused embarrassment had I entered unannounced at the wrong time. An unacceptable security lapse. It's position near the corner of two of Sydney's busiest streets (a lot of traffic noise in poorly insulated rooms) only adds to the misery suffered by guests at this truly horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Frigid Rydges !”
Reviews.Author: pauljamesg
Reviews.Content: Spent one night too long in a draughty western facing room with no heating & utterly frigid air-con that could not be turned into warm mode .The window facing west had a severe draught all night with strong westerly winds .The aircon seemed to only do cold and colder so was not turned on .During the night this guest woke up to a freezing room due to bad draught from the poorly sealed window & nil heating.A search for an extra blanket in the room was futile so I returned to bed fully clothed. When reception was informed of these problems on check-out they were utterly insouciant -mention was made of an intended upgrade.No compensation was offered eg by waiving the parking charge or 3.5% credit card surcharge.Never again for this Rydges Priority club member .NOT recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: reinga
Reviews.Content: Overall, I consider this a good hotel. I had recently stayed in the Rydges World Square; the Rydges Camperdown obviously loses in the comparison. The building is not as modern and the location is not as central. I chose the Rydges Camperdown this time because I had a rental car. The hotel location allowed me to drive to the institution I was visiting without having to drive in the CBD. Besides, I found the parking rates at the hotel very reasonable (12 AUD per day). The parking lot, however is for "experts". I have never seen so many columns in my life. I managed ok, but it must be scary for non-expert drivers. The location is fine, with the restaurants along King St, Newton, within walking distance. My room was big, and with nice views of the city skyline. It is true that some aspects of the room were a bit dated, but it was just a question of aesthetics. Everything was perfectly usable. At least in my room, what I think would be best renovating is the carpeting and the stove in the kitchen (I forgot to mention, my room had a kitchen, which I found a nice addition to your regular hotel room).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location but beware of phone charges”
Reviews.Author: Robyn007
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 nights at the Rydges Camperdown, whilst the hotel is looking tired it is clean and comfortable and well located within walking distance to Newtown and Glebe where one can find no end of choice in cafe`s, restaurants, wine bars and quirky shops. I found the staff to be courteous and helpful, my only complaint is charges for making a phone call. My mobile phone was down so I made a 2 minute phone call to a local mobile from the room and was charged $9.90. As an Australian and knowing how much a phone call to a moblie actually costs I do not understand how you can justify these charges. I note that this is not the first complaint about phone charges perhaps the charges should be clearly displayed on the phone instead of in a hand book so that unsespecting customers are aware. Apart from the phone charges I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: GanjaFarmer
Reviews.Content: Rooms are tired and look like the 60's but service is top range! Bar and Restaurant is awesome quiet and relaxing. Food is great and the location is super!

Reviews.Title: “Due to old reviews I prepared for the worst, yet I was pleasantly suprised with the accommodation and proximity to RPA.”
Reviews.Author: Scroopy
Reviews.Content: Reviews from many months ago painted a grim picture of this hotel. It was clear that the hotel I was about to stay in was not of the calibre of say, Parramatta Rydges which I frequent alot. As I had to stay close to RPA due to my partner in having surgery, I was not prepared to pay $180 a night to stay at Quest as a single and thought I'd 'risk it' with Rydges at Camperdown. My room, and from what I could tell from the carpets replaced etc throughout the floor, has indeed been re-furbished, albeit the bathroom with remained 80's style, but yet functional. Throughout the day tradesman were in and out of the hotel obviously making the necessary modifications (and intermitent noise). My room, a double/double was clean comfortable, and to my suprise and delight, a very large plasma/LCD TV. The beds, are comfortable enough, although I'm sure they will also be upgraded to the "Dream Beds" other Rygdes hotels provide. (Would be a good investment as they are a dream to sleep on) I had one incident of disruption of a group of men in the room next door. From the early afternoon you could tell they would be trouble, swearing, drinking etc. The had gone out for the night and I just knew I'd be woken when they returned. That they did, at 5am. One ph call to downstairs and security was called. No less then 5mins later they were paid a visit, and thankfully.....Quit the noise. Just a tip, I opted for a non-smoking room after originally been provided with a room on level 4. Despite being a smoker, I opted not to stay on the floor due to the stagnent smoke smell, even I couldn't stand it. I was then given a room on level one which smelt fresh and clean. Non smokers would not be able to bear level 4, so steer clear if this is the case. I'd stay here again for it's reasonable price, and closeness to RPA. The IRO Cafe/restaurant up the road makes fantastic Brekkies if the buffet at the hotel is not your style.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, convenient & cheap”
Reviews.Author: playitagain007
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Rydges Camperdown during Mardi Gras. It was great. We were really pleased with the service as the staff really went out of their way to look after us. Thanks & happy Mardi Gras!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Starr69
Reviews.Content: This is a great value for money hotel just out of the CBD. We used it as a base for looking around Sydney and it was terrific. The staff we fantastic and very helpful. Recommend it to anyone that does not want to pay the earth for a CBD hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to city and RPA”
Reviews.Author: Harmony911
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really close to RPA..only 100 metres away. The service is friendly, and my room was really big. I had breakfast and it was excellent. Yes the rooms need new carpet, but for the price its great value.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Dangerous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: infinityAucklandNZ
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a fire and health hazard and should be closed down. I was disgusted at the state of the Hotel when I stayed there last week for business. Cockroaches meandered in and out of the air conditioning ducts that were clogged with years of dirty grey dust. Carpets were full of dust and covered completely in stains that looked as though they had not even been attempted to be cleaned. There was hair in the bathroom sink, paint peeling of the bath. The electric jug did not fit under the handbasin facet so you had to try and fill it over the bath, the bath controller was locked permanently in off position so you could only fill the jug over the shower head that was also clogged with soap scum. Old coffee and coffee wrappers were inside the drawer where the coffee was kept. Cigarette burns on most of the furniture. I refused to stay in the first room and was given the only other available room a 'smoking room' which was not much better than the first. Frankly given the gap under the doors in the room and that they have guest smoking rooms in it and clogged air conditioning units I think this is a recipe for a Hotel Fire, which would possibly claim many lives. I hope in writing this here that others do not book this Hotel since you are putting your lives and health at risk. I will write to Sydney Fire Brigade also since I feel that it is the only thing i can do to assist others. There are quest apartments next door to this Hotel which look alot better and given the short trip by sydney light rail I would stay in the city next time and commute out. Namaste Jackie

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: osocurious
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a weeks stay. The room is large and comfortable. The front desk is very attentive and helpful. For me the location was great. I needed easy access to the University of Sydney and Rydges is a short walk away. A major public transportation artery (Parramatta Rd) is right outside. For a nice bohemian feel, a short walk away is King Street. Restaurants, funky shops, cafe's, theaters, kind of fun to check it out. As mentioned below the place is in need of updating, and they are working on it. The only 2 problems I had with my room were the television is very old (refurbishment tbd), and I was put on a Smoking floor without being asked my preference. The vent system was poor if someone smoked in a nearby room, the smell became quite strong in my room. But an open window helped. The view of the city was fantastic. The price, unlike the previous reviewer, was reasonable based on my search of similar offerings in the area. Again, location was important to me. It wasn't awful, it's a little dated but they are working on it. I felt very comfortable in my room and the lobby/restaurant/bar area. They are clean, just a little old. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If I needed to be in this part of Sydney again, I'd give them another look. I look forward to seeing the refurbishments. One issue I had though is local phone charges. There is no warning, and as a foreign traveler used to free local charges (minus the occaisional connect charge) I was shocked to be charged as much as $6 per minute for local calls. I had to make several local calls and my bill at the end of the week came as a bit of a surprise. A warning placard would have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Adventurer
Reviews.Content: I found this place horribly depressing and could not wait to leave. (I almost walked out when I saw the room--I should have, but I was too exhausted.) This shabby, run-down hotel is dramatically overpriced. I paid $150 for a room whose carpet was worn down in spots to the floorboard below. I refused to touch the old, dirty hot water kettle. The shower walls have stains throughout. Do not stay here until the place is refurbished: you will get better value for the money almost anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “huge rooms, but could do with some modernisation”
Reviews.Author: jel79
Reviews.Content: We had 2 family rooms which were interconnecting. The rooms both contained two double beds and a small kitchenette. The rooms were large, had ample storage for longer stays and we had views over the pool. While the rooms were clean, they are in need of modernisation. I would guess by looking at the decor that they havent been re-decorated in at least 10 or so years. The only other negative I have about the room is the air conditioning. There is only the option to have it on low, medium or high, but no actual temperature control. We needed something, but after only a minute on low, we were freezing. We arrived late at the motel after a long flight and ordered room service from the menu in our rooms. Our meals arrived very quickly, and were tasty, although a tad expensive. Even though the decor was outdated, its location is convenient to both the airport and city, and the rooms are very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: syvergy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in two Hotels for work purposes in Sydney and this one was the better of the two... barely. I'll start with what was good - The room service, which had a tasty menu and good prices. It was very prompt and a good temperature. The only exception to this was one of my breakfasts - most of it was cold and rubbery - like someone had pre-cooked it and left it under a heatlamp. The beds were large, like the room. The curtains blocked out sun, and the windows were nice and big with a great view of the city. The bathroom was a good size and all the bits and pieces were there. The room itself was a bit rundown, but it was clean and comfortable. With more then enough space to move around and store luggage and belongings. There was Internet access in the room as well as a proper desk, table and chair. Turndown service was good and the reception was polite and called me a cab everyday. Unfortunately, there were quite a few bad factors too. The TV was just stuffed. The reception on all channels (including pay-per-view) was completely blurry. I called reception but they said there was nothing they could do. For such basic amenity its something that should be at least watchable. The lift is appauling. Its slow, clunky, sounds like its going to fall and I crossed my fingers every time I got into it. The decor outside the rooms is what I can only describe as completely dated, the carpet and walls were stained/peeling and it was just simply depressing. The room was sound proofed from outside noise, but for two nights (during the week) there were people running in and out of rooms and around the corridors all night at around 3-4am. Reception refused to do anything about it. How can business travellers stay in a Hotel that allows people to run rampant around the place, holding parties in rooms in the early hours of a work day? The location is out in the middle of the inner-suburbs so its not close to the CBD, which is fine if you can navigate Sydney public transport (ugh) or your work is covering cab fares. All in all, a reasonably comfortable stay, the hotel just needs to be updated and refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ozziesteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rydges Camperdown for one night last weekend. (thank god it was only one night) What a shocker! Cracks in the wall, filthy worn carpet, cigarette burns on the furniture. Even the lampshades were stained. I've stayed at a stack of hotels over the past 10 years, but this one was the worst by far. I put in a written complaint, but of course the management haven't bothered to respond. Do youself a favour - stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own cleaning kit!”
Reviews.Author: JimmyD_8
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay in Hotels and some are good, some are not so good but this is the first time that I have actually complained about a hotel. On arrival, I opened the fridge to take a drink from the mini-bar and there were two half used tubs (one i think coleslaw, the other curry sauce) staring at me open in the fridge. The toilet had a black rim just above the waterline and there were also empty beer bottles behind the curtains. The carpet was very grubby and the bath was in need of a paint. The woman on reception said they were in the process of refurbishing - i can understand thus, to an extent, the carpet being grubby and the bath. However, this is not an excuse for downright filthy rooms. I was going to say nothing until my bill was entirely incorrect- despite booking accomodation for one, my bill was charging me for two breakfasts each morning. In addition, i was overcharged $30 for use of the mini bar. Obviously these were corrected but it exemplified for me the approach in the hotel. The woman on reception seemed more interested in getting me to join their priority club- as if I was ever going to stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, rooms a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Zammit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to the other standards of Rydges that i have stayed at in the past. The hotel is close to the Uni, RPA and only a couple of kms from the city. As for the rooms, if you get a city view the view of the city is nice but the rooms are a little tired and give off a dirty feel mainly as the carpet is terrible. There are holes its worn and there are stains. You can see that housekeeping do their best to make these rooms presentable they are just old thats all. Overall if you get this hotel at the right price (around $120) it is still quite a pleasant stay with nice staff and comfortable beds. Good for a night!

Reviews.Title: “rydges is a good option”
Reviews.Author: albertst
Reviews.Content: Rydges Camperdown is a good comfortable older hotel, some shabby aspects, but clean comfortable quiet rooms and good beds, Excellent location with a wonderful buffet breakfast. Good front of house staff, slow lifts!

Reviews.Title: “Location good for the price”
Reviews.Author: blober0
Reviews.Content: The Rydges Camperdown was a decent hotel, but not outstanding at all. We stayed here over NYE because prices downtown were too expensive. The location is great to get in/out of downtown without much trouble at all, just a cheap bus fare each time and several buses to choose from. We were a little disappointed with a few things in our room - the window wouldn't shut all the way so it was noisy on windy days, there was a big dip in the floor near the bar area, and the heat/air system was very loud & smelly when you first turn it on. Considering we stayed for NYE, the price was decent and location good, but wouldn't spend the money any other time of the year. Staff was EXTREMELY helpful with all aspects of us visiting - helping with transportation options, helping book tours, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: onehitwonder
Reviews.Content: Room clean and Ok. Shame about the lack of cleanliness in the outside areas such as the broken bottles in carpark lift foyer and cigarette butts and rubbish in stairwells and around pool area. Carpark, although free which is unusual for inner Sydney, is a nightmare: the forest of closely spaced concrete pillars are difficult to negotiate if you've got a large car.Lack of communication between staff shows inexperience or indifference to guests' needs and maybe the hospitality industry isn't where they should be.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap accomodation, only 5 mins to sydney central”
Reviews.Author: Raff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located next to sydney uni, it's on the bus route straight into sydney central, a mere 5mins or if you are feeling energetic 20mins walk. We liked where the hotel was because it was away from the noisy traffic of town, but close enough that we didn't feel as though it was a chore to travel in everyday. It's also 5mins walk from Newtown, which is full of bars, cafes and cheap clothes shops. The bus is only about $1.60(aus) and it will take you all the way to the Rocks for $2.20 in about 10/15mins depending on traffic. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and the food wasn't bad either. It has a pool and a sauna, which is a bonus. You can get some really good views of Sydney from the top floors. We paid about $110 aus dollars a night for a king room over Xmas and New Year, which was pretty good value considering that the YHA was more or less the same price. All in all, we would stay at the hotel again!
